ygData.subject: RE: [cantera] Re: fPIC problem on 64-bit RH Enterprise Linux 5
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I ve found the same thing. Specifically, when compiling on 64 bit systems, it s necessary to make sure that all shared libraries have all of their static

Hi,
   I've found the same thing. Specifically, when compiling on 64 bit
sy=
stems, it's necessary to make sure that all shared libraries have all
of th=
eir static library dependencies compiled with the -fPIC compilation
option =
(or equivalent).  This is not necessarily true for 32 bit shared
library co=
mpiles. I'' try to make sure the Makefiles reflect this fact
in the future.=


Best wishes,
Harry Moffat

bject: [cantera] Re: fPIC problem on 64-bit RH Enterprise Linux 5

--- In c=
antera@yahoogroups.com, "yarmond" <yarmond@...> wrote:
>
> I had a similar =
problem installing Cantera on a 64-bit Ubuntu system, 
> and found that com=
piling Sundials with -fPIC solved my problems, i.e.
> run the configure scr=
ipt for sundials with the options 
> --with-cflags=3D-fPIC --with-cppflags=
=3D-fPIC
> 
> --- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Mirko" <mvukovic@> wrote:
> =
>
> > Hi,
> > 
> > I downloaded cantera 1.7.0 yesterday from sourceforge.
>=
 > 
> > I get an error when running "make python-install" with the message =

> > that I need to recompile with -fPIC.
> > 
> > I have seen several emai=
ls with the same topic.  But some of them 
> > indicate that the problem wa=
s resolved in version 1.7.1.  Where can 
> > I find that version (I looked =
briefly at the CVS and did not see 
> > anything newer than 1.7, except for=
 Makefile.in)?
> > 
> > (I am not super-comfortable modifying the makefiles=
, but with clear 
> > enough instructions I am willing to do it).
> > 
> > =
In case it is of relevance, I think I have 64-bit python, simply 
> > becau=
se my python2.4 sits in the /usr/lib64 directory.  (It came
> > pre-install=
ed)
> > 
> > Thank you very much,
> > 
> > Mirko
> >
>
I took one more look=
 at the various emails, and decided to explicitly
add the -fPIC option to t=
he CXXFLAGS in preconfig.  I then cleaned up
and re-built and re-installed =
everything:

make
sudo make install
make python
sudo make python-install

N=
ow make test passes.

Mirko
